dublinCore.dc:title: 110 HR 1925 IH: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veteransâ€™ Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a separate Veterans Integrated Service Network for the Gulf Coast region of the United States.

section.header: Establishment of Gulf Coast Veterans Integrated Service Network

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a separate Veterans Affairs Service Network (in this Act referred to as a VISN) for the Gulf Coast region of the United States, to comprise the following counties:

paragraph.text: In the State of Florida, the counties of Franklin, Liberty, Gulf, Calhoun, Jackson, Bay, Washington, Holmes, Walton, Okaloosa, Santa Rosa, and Escambia.
In the State of Alabama, the counties of Houston, Henry, Dale, Geneva, Coffee, Covington, Conecuh, Escambia, Monroe, Baldwin, Clarke, Mobile, and Washington.
In the State of Mississippi, the counties of Jackson, George, Harrison, Stone, Hancock, and Pearl River.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall establish the VISN specified in subsection (a) not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
